name: ATR72 Full Flight Dublin to Glasgow 1080p
description:
Welcome!  This is a full flight video aboard Aer Lingus Flight 3222 with nonstop service from Dublin International Airport to Glasgow International Airport in Scotland aboard an ATR 72-600 turboprop plane!

After a short stay in Dublin, my family left the day before St. Patrick's Day to avoid the crowds and continued our journey in Scotland.  We boarded planeside and after a very short delay began taxiing for a cloudy takeoff from Runway 10.  It only took a few minutes to get above the clouds and enjoy the beautiful vistas as we crossed the Irish Sea!  Our flight time was scheduled for less than an hour, and soon we descended through the clouds from the west for a smooth landing at Glasgow International Airport.
 
Thanks again for watching, and enjoy!

--------------------------------

Flight Information
Airline: Aer Lingus
Operator: Stobart Air
Flight Number: EI3222
Date of Flight: Wednesday, March 16th, 2016

Origin Airport: Dublin International Airport (EIDW/DUB)
Destination Airport: Glasgow International Airport (EGPF/GLA)

Departing Gate: 402
Scheduled Departure: 10:05 GMT
Actual Departure from Gate: 10:09 GMT
Takeoff Runway and Time: RWY 10 / 10:23 GMT
Landing Runway and Time: RWY 5 / 11:10 GMT
Scheduled Arrival: 11:10 GMT
Actual Arrival at Gate: 11:19 GMT
Arriving Gate: 29

--------------------------------

Aircraft Information
Type: ATR 72-600
Registration: EI-FAV
Aircraft Delivery: September 2013
Engines: 2x Pratt & Whitney Canada PW127M
Seat/s: 4D & 4F

--------------------------------

Video Highlights and Timeline
00:30 - Engine Start and Taxi
01:50 - Takeoff
04:00 - Initial Descent
04:50 - Approach
07:00 - Landing

--------------------------------

Technical Specs
Camera: Nikon D3200 with 18-55mm lenses

A big thanks to my wife Beth as my assistant throughout the journey!
